channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2023090624
item.description:
Report X-2023090624

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-11
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged hazmat was discovered this morning on the inbound sometime after receiving its inbound scan. it was placed in a lined tote and brought to the damage area where it was moved to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: drum leaked due to loose cover. there is pink staining on the ridges below the bottom of the cover, the same color as the liquid product. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: someone called out a damaged hazmat. QA admin responded and went to retrieve it, placing it in a lined tote and bringing it back to the damage area. he moved it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one can leaked from the body due to the bottom rim coming separated from the body. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report I-2023090138
item.description:
Report I-2023090138

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: Edina
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver arrived at customer location to fill a Dimethylformamide(DMF) tank. He verified the tank, quantity, and connection prior to starting to pump. After several moments after beginning transfer, customer employee notified driver that nothing was transferring. Driver inspected the connections and proceeded to check on the internal valve, which he closed and opened again. After doing so a cap on the rear of the trailer popped off and product started coming out of the open pipe. Driver shutdown the pump and approximately 90 gallons of DMF spilled into the customer's containment. The cause of the release was the result of a faulty outlet cap. During the investigation it was determined that there was no isolation valve installed behind the cap.
